docs.text: vampire films , as well as other horror films , are usually dumb and predictable b-movies , meant to scare us by cliches and simple shocks .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it is therefore interesting to watch neil jordans recent film that is not only visually stunning , but has also a plot worth making movies about .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: based on anne rice's novel , " interview with a vampire " is a long , dark trip to hell .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the film opens with gothic quire and dark streets of present-day san francisco .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the camera slowly find particular window .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a shape of a young man is visible in the darkness .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " so you want me to tell you the story of my life ? " .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the mysterious man is louis ( brad pitt ) , a two-century old vampire , telling his story to a fascinated interviewer ( christian slater ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: his tale opens in 1791 louisiana , just south of new orleans , where louis falls victim to the vampire lestat ( tom cruise ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: given a choice between death and eternal life as one of the undead , louis chooses the latter , a decision he will forever regret .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: everlasting life and eternal youth , promised to him by lestat , turn instead into never ending suffering , damned to eternal hunger for blood and longing for peace .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: louis cannot kill with the impunity of lestat , but , to sate his hunger , he must feed , and the blood of animals is not enough .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: eventually , he pierces the neck of a grief-stricken young girl named claudia ( kirsten dunst ) , whom lestat then curses with his unholy form of resurrection so that she can be a surrogate daughter to both himself and louis .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: for a while , they are one " big , happy family . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but all things end , and claudia's growing resentment of lestat fuels a bloody confrontation .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: when luis and claudia break loose from lestat , they travel to paris , where the euro-vamps santiago ( stephen rea ) and armand ( antonio banderas ) , who introduced them to a bigger world of the damned .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: director neil jordan ( " the crying game " ) together with the talented director of cinematography philippe rousselot and composer elliot goldenthal has created an incredible atmosphere .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as the film begins , there is an incredible palette of colors , beautiful sunrises , lush golden fields , green forests , inky-blue clouds and blending sun .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: when luis is " born to darkness " , everything suddenly changes to dark velvet , lit only by the silver moonlight .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the beautiful production design by dante ferretti , wonderful costumes and art direction by malcolm middleton re-create the multiple historical periods in the film .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: from the renaissance new orleans and the beautiful rococo paris of the 18th century , to our present days .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the casting is likewise good , involving some of the most famous and beautiful stars of hollywood , ireland and spain .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the controversial casting of tom cruise as lestat is incredibly effective .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: cruise is energetic , sinister , charismatic , wild and bloodthirsty .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: cruise's lestat likes to seduce young women before exacting his dark red sustenance .

docs.text: with alarming swiftness , the victims switch from sexual excitement to outright horror , as his murderous purpose becomes clear .

docs.text: but behind that furious facade is anger and loneliness that he carries through the centuries and tries to smother with nightly rampages .

docs.text: brad pitt is equally convincing as the " vampire with a human soul " .

docs.text: antonio banderas and stephen rea are effective , but since they play more or less secondary characters , their performances are almost invisible .

docs.text: the greatest performance in the film comes suprisingly from the young kristen dunst , who manages to create an incredibly emotional and believable character .

docs.text: the world is changing around the little child , but she does not .

docs.text: she remains unchangeable - a child for all eternity .

docs.text: ironically the film's only miss is the script .

docs.text: anne rice's novel is a very interesting read , and her script is rich , colorful and emotional , but it is also tiering and too melancholic , at times resembling a soap opera :

docs.text: neil jordan's direction is beautiful and sensual as he plays with interesting issues like eternity , homosexuality , love and loneliness .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: his gothic saga is not meant to scare , but to display these issues differently .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: wrapped up in mystery , his new , original picture brings vampire-films to a new height .
docs.label: positive
